title: ForeTable for Notables: An Intermediary System between Notables and People
title_en: ForeTable for Notables: An Intermediary System between Notables and People
abstract: 本研究は著名人と一般人の間を仲介するWeb／ソーシャルメディア領域のプロトタイプシステムを提案する。 本研究はWebとソーシャルメディアから情報を収集してHTMLやURLの抽出とソーシャルメディア検索APIとの連携により情報を提示し、物理プロトタイプは約100×70×70mmで汎用マイコンと外部電源（DC 12V）を用いて構築した。
abstract_en: This paper proposes a prototype system that mediates between notables and people in the web/social media domain. The system collects information from the web and social media, extracts HTML and URLs, integrates with social media search APIs, and the physical prototype was built at approximately 100×70×70mm using a general-purpose microcontroller and an external DC 12V power supply.
positioning_summary: 本研究は著名人と一般人の間を仲介するWeb／ソーシャルメディア領域のシステムとして位置づけている。 本研究はWeb上の情報収集と提示を通じて両者の接点や対話を促進することが重要であると位置づけている。
positioning_summary_en: This research positions itself as a system in the web/social media domain that mediates between notables and people. This research positions the collection and presentation of web information as important for promoting contact and dialogue between the two groups.
purpose_summary: 本研究は著名人と一般市民の間に存在する情報接触のギャップを解消することを目的としている。 本研究は著名人側と一般人側の双方が影響を受ける仲介機能を提供することを目指している。
purpose_summary_en: This study aims to close the information-contact gap between notables and ordinary citizens. This study aims to provide an intermediary function that affects both the notable side and the general public side.
method_summary: 本研究はWebとソーシャルメディアから情報を収集・抽出して表示する仲介システムのプロトタイプを設計した。 本研究はHTMLやURLの抽出やソーシャルメディア検索APIとの連携を行い、物理プロトタイプを約100×70×70mmで汎用マイコンと外部電源（DC 12V）を用いて構築した。
method_summary_en: This study designed a prototype intermediary system that collects, extracts, and displays information from the web and social media. This study performed HTML and URL extraction and integration with social media search APIs and constructed a physical prototype approximately 100×70×70mm using a general-purpose microcontroller and an external DC 12V power supply.
evaluation_summary: 本研究はWebデータ収集とソーシャルメディア検索APIを用いたデータ取得および物理プロトタイプの構築と動作確認によって評価を行った。 本研究は評価でデータ取得と物理プロトタイプの動作確認を報告したが、参加者数や定量的な評価結果などの詳細な成果は報告していない。
evaluation_summary_en: This study evaluated the system by performing web data collection, data retrieval via social media search APIs, and construction and operation confirmation of a physical prototype. This study reported data retrieval and operation confirmation of the physical prototype but did not report detailed outcomes such as participant numbers or quantitative evaluation results.

paths: Human-centered computing → Collaborative and social computing → Collaborative and social computing systems and tools
Human-centered computing → Collaborative and social computing → Collaborative and social computing theory, concepts and paradigms → Social media
Information systems → World Wide Web → Web applications → Social networks

llm_explanations.justification: Prototype system mediating between notables and people; collects and displays social/web data.

llm_explanations.path: Human-centered computing → Collaborative and social computing → Collaborative and social computing theory, concepts and paradigms → Social media
llm_explanations.justification: Integrates social media search APIs and targets social media interactions.

llm_explanations.path: Information systems → World Wide Web → Web applications → Social networks
llm_explanations.justification: Operates on web/social data and URLs to mediate contact via web applications.

Focus is system/prototype, not primarily interaction design theory or tools.
Too broad (general human-centered computing) compared to more specific concepts chosen.

prompt.system: You are an expert indexer who assigns ACM CCS 2012 concepts to computing research papers. You will receive the paper's title, abstract, and structured summaries. Use only the provided candidate concepts. Select at most 3 concepts that best describe the paper. If none of the candidates fit, return an empty list.
prompt.user:
Year: 2010

Paper summary:
Title: ForeTable for Notables: An Intermediary System between Notables and People
Authors: Ryutaro Motora, Kazuya Fujisawa, Michiaki Yasumura
Year: 2010
Abstract: This paper proposes a prototype system that mediates between notables and people in the web/social media domain. The system collects information from the web and social media, extracts HTML and URLs, integrates with social media search APIs, and the physical prototype was built at approximately 100×70×70mm using a general-purpose microcontroller and an external DC 12V power supply.
Positioning Summary: This research positions itself as a system in the web/social media domain that mediates between notables and people. This research positions the collection and presentation of web information as important for promoting contact and dialogue between the two groups.
Purpose Summary: This study aims to close the information-contact gap between notables and ordinary citizens. This study aims to provide an intermediary function that affects both the notable side and the general public side.
Method Summary: This study designed a prototype intermediary system that collects, extracts, and displays information from the web and social media. This study performed HTML and URL extraction and integration with social media search APIs and constructed a physical prototype approximately 100×70×70mm using a general-purpose microcontroller and an external DC 12V power supply.
Evaluation Summary: This study evaluated the system by performing web data collection, data retrieval via social media search APIs, and construction and operation confirmation of a physical prototype. This study reported data retrieval and operation confirmation of the physical prototype but did not report detailed outcomes such as participant numbers or quantitative evaluation results.

Respond with JSON using the following schema:
{
  "ccs": [
    {
      "id": "concept id string",
      "path": "concept path string",
      "confidence": "high|medium|low",
      "justification": "brief reason citing evidence from the paper summary"
    }
  ],
  "rejected": [
    {
      "id": "concept id string",
      "reason": "why it was excluded"
    }
  ]
}
Always use candidate IDs exactly as provided. Do not invent new concepts. Limit the array under "ccs" to at most 3 entries. Limit the array under "rejected" to at most 5 entries. Keep every justification or reason concise (no more than 120 characters).
